unit: Unit 7 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Means
title: Test of Significance: Do Men Make More Money than Women?
question_text: A committee has been formed to see if men have higher salaries(in dollars), on average than women at the company You Rule .  Independent random samples  were obtained and the data is summarized in the table below. Gender Men at You Rule Women at You Rule Mean Salary $63,364$ $62,578$ Standard Deviation of Salary $4352$ $3456$ n $102$ $91$ Based on the data which of the following statements is true?

choices.text: At the 1 1 % significance level, there is significant evidence men get paid more than women at You Rule .
At the 5 5 % significance level, there is significant evidence men get paid more than women at You Rule .
At the 5 5 % significance level, there is significant evidence men and women get paid equally at You Rule .
At the 10 10 % significance level, there is significant evidence men get paid more than women at this company at You Rule .
At the 10 10 % significance level, there is significant evidence men and women get paid equally at You Rule .
